attributes.magic: Unicode text, UTF-16, little-endian text, with very long lines (32767u), with no line terminators

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects suspicious base64 encoded PowerShell expressions
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation

Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "AccessVBOM" to a value of "1" which disables trust access for VBA on the victim machine and lets attackers execute malicious macros without any Microsoft Office warnings.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changes to Microsoft Office protected view registry keys with which the attacker disables this feature.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=796B784E98008854C27F4B18D287BA30,SHA256=356280CCA63CA5E887FDBE5CB4105A53341FBAC9219EFC51621DF9BA8EE9838B,IMPHASH=ECCE05491F2E8F279F4790BCB1318C05; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; FileVersion=10.0.19041.906 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -File "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\CA03F4D9988A366CBBD96C24857E87374568EC5A4AAA4E55FE2C3C7E.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\schtasks.exe" /Create /RU system /SC ONLOGON /TN Microsoft\WindowsDifenderUpdate /TR "wscript C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.vbs" /F; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Hashes=SHA1=815A050FC4BD12C6CA0B62D38D0FB6F8A95F70A8,MD5=838D346D1D28F00783B7A6C6BD03A0DA,SHA256=8BE433049CCC271F04A8E625E9FB9BD3BCF15B4EDEB63497C00BD9CE1CD5C50E,IMPHASH=7EE4BC5589713B3470B8A950256E2E69; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\CA03F4D9988A366CBBD96C24857E87374568EC5A4AAA4E55FE2C3C7E.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\schtasks.exe" /Create /RU system /SC ONLOGON /TN Microsoft\WindowsDifenderUpdate /TR "wscript C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.vbs" /F; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Schtasks Creation Or Modification With SYSTEM Privileges
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Hashes=MD5=796B784E98008854C27F4B18D287BA30,SHA256=356280CCA63CA5E887FDBE5CB4105A53341FBAC9219EFC51621DF9BA8EE9838B,IMPHASH=ECCE05491F2E8F279F4790BCB1318C05; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -File "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\CA03F4D9988A366CBBD96C24857E87374568EC5A4AAA4E55FE2C3C7E.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\schtasks.exe" /Create /RU system /SC ONLOGON /TN Microsoft\WindowsDifenderUpdate /TR "wscript C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.vbs" /F; FileVersion=10.0.19041.906 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=ATTRIB.EXE; Hashes=MD5=5037D8E6670EF1D89FB6AD435F12A9FD,SHA256=1043111FF07814B0D3439561B4CEE5D7EC1799A7A0A419949FEE707666F6DDED,IMPHASH=2CB38FE7D8F223D9DA50B7CBA9B95A6D; Description=Attribute Utility; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -File "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\CA03F4D9988A366CBBD96C24857E87374568EC5A4AAA4E55FE2C3C7E.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\attrib.exe" +s +h C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.vbs; FileVersion=10.0.19041.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\attrib.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "VBAWarning" to a value of "1" which enables the execution of all macros, whether signed or unsigned.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Command Patterns In Scheduled Task Creation
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects scheduled task creation using "schtasks" that contain potentially suspicious or uncommon commands

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Type With High Privileges
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects scheduled task creations or modification to be run with high privileges on a suspicious schedule type

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.
